sub_title: Lead Software Engineer at Wells Fargo
summary:
I am looking for a position in a growing company with financial/banking, facilitating e-commerce payments or healthcare.  Interested in remote or hybrid opportunities. 

I am a hands-on enterprise banking projects (mostly in java) technical lead with project management experience onboarding and mentoring developers.  I have done hands-on coding, DevOps, project management and teach lead.  My projects have spanned from platform migrations, enhancements, upgrades (platform upgrades, compliance, security and tracking) to monitoring, analyzing platform bottlenecks and for black swan events. 

I am a tinkerer by nature.  I learn by mimicking, refine by iteration and optimize by automating repetitive processes.  I am curious about how things work and always like to try to learn by recreating what I am curious about and making it better.  

I am able to work in the Netherlands, U.S or Singapore.

My Past: 
I was born in Singapore did my Comp Sci degree in the U.S. and have recently relocated to Amsterdam. 

In college, I picked up C/C++, VB, HTML, ASP, SQL and assembly (MIPS/RISC).   

Via work, I have experience with the following stacks HTML/JS/Java/ATG to CSS/Web Portals/BEA/SVN/MVC/Spring to  React/Java/Apache/Git/CPF and have gone through many different dev tools. 

Favourite projects:
My favourite project at Wells Fargo was reverse engineering and rewriting (web services upgrade) the Personal Loans app, upgrading our backend protocol to mutual auth and implementing a batch server job that reconciles our submitted apps with fulfilment enabling the bank visibility and ability to recover lost applications (between front end submissions to back-office processing) regardless of the events leading to that failure. 

Pet projects: 
I have picked up programming languages, set up (Novell/windows network administration to Linux) servers and OSses (Linux flavours,  AWS Cloud server setups, etc.) out of plain curiosity, writing a script to automate character levelling on a MUD or a vacation home rental system (before Airbnb), hackingDebian on iMac G3 (a variant of Hackintosh) or repairing hardware devices (comfortable with breadboarding, circuit design and soldering).  

I headed the Parent-Teacher Association for 120 families.  I liaised between the families and school, hosted weekly community events, holiday events (parties and craft projects), excursions and fundraising events.  I am particularly proud that those efforts resulted in a close-knit, inclusive, engaging and productive community.
